comments:
3.1RC1

I attempted to "Display" the expression "this.get(1).toString()" from the 
details pane of the variables view, with the variable "list" selected when at 
a breakpoint in the following code, and had stepped two lines further:

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

public class Test {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		List<String> list = new ArrayList<String>(); // Breakpoint
		list.add("sam");
		list.add("two");
		int x =6; // STEP TO HERE
		assert x > 5;
		List<Fruit> bowl = new ArrayList<Fruit>();
		bowl.add(Fruit.APPLE);
		bowl.add(Fruit.MANGO);
	}
	
	enum Fruit {
		APPLE, ORANGE, BANANA, MANGO
	}
}

patch for org.eclipse.jdt.debug
Luc, can you verify the patch to the ASTInstructionCompiler.

Created an attachment (id=22198)
updated patch to jdt.debug

There no need to call getBinaryName(). If a variable type has no bounds, its
runtime type is java.lang.Object.
Otherwise, that looks good.
Thanks. Fixed in ASTInstructionCompiler and EvaluateAction.
